01.title: Product Planning
01.content: Product dept forms initial concept based on ops needs and company plan, communicates with decision makers for alignment.

02.title: Market Research
02.content: Conduct market research and output 'Market Research Report' for ops dept and decision makers.

03.title: Requirement Definition
03.content: Define product requirements, output 'Product Requirement Document' (PRD).
outputs: Product positioning: scenarios, selling points, user groups

04.title: PRD Review
04.content: Organize review of PRD with Ops and Quality. Unclear or unreasonable definitions must be revised and re-reviewed.

05.title: Publish PRD
05.content: Formally publish PRD via email after approval. Future changes require re-review and version upgrade notification.
05.note: Key Control Point: PRD is key output of concept phase; Ops makes sales/promo plans based on it; Quality uses it for standards/testing.

06.title: Sourcing
06.content: Source target products (functional samples) per PRD. Require: â‰¥3 target products, â‰¥2 samples each.

07.title: Sample Testing
07.content: Product & Ops conduct experience testing; Quality conducts quality testing.

08.title: Sample Review
08.content: Product organizes review of test findings, solutions, and requirement changes after testing.

09.title: Quality Standard Output
09.content: Quality dept formulates quality standards after testing/review and releases to Purchasing.

10.title: Business Negotiation
10.content: Purchasing communicates plan with Ops/Product, negotiates with suppliers based on standards/payment terms.

11.title: Factory Audit
11.content: Key products or >500k amount require audit. Three parties output reports; Quality scores for final decision.

12.title: Project Initiation Review
12.content: Product organizes initiation review with all depts and decision makers after sample/audit approval.

13.title: Project Decision
13.content: Final decision on procurement. Product leads signing of 'Project Initiation Form'.

14.title: Final Sampling
14.content: Purchasing leads final sampling and payment after project approval.

15.title: Sample Signing
15.content: Joint signing of final samples. Company keeps 2 sets (Quality/Ops).

16.title: Order Placement
16.content: Purchasing places order after sample signing.

17.title: Production
17.content: Supplier produces per order. Purchasing monitors schedule and notifies Quality/Ops.

18.title: Inspection
18.content: Quality arranges QC/arrival inspection. Report issued next day.

19.title: Logistics & Inbound
19.content: Execute transport and warehousing after inspection.

20.title: Listing & Sales
20.content: Ops arranges listing and sales based on inbound status. End of process.

contactPage.title: Contact Us
